title: Stupid Taliyah (?)buff(?) idea
body: What if Riot changed all her damage from magic damage to physical damage (Not the scaling, just the damage output). It would give her an interesting niche and it would mean that all those AD/MR items that are all the rage right now wouldn't be good against her. It would also give her a real niche that no other mage has.

Agreed, I think this would be awesome. On the same note, how about {{champion:12}} who punches the ground and headbutts people but deals magical damage.

On one hand, I like this, because it makes thematic sense and could open up some funny itemization paths and power quirks. On the other, I also feel that might be confusing, since AP is generally associated with magic damage and AD with physical damage, so an AP-scaling physical damage mage is going to lead to a lot of players stacking MR and realizing it's useless against her.

On a more abstract level, though, I think it's worth questioning what damage types really do right now: the conceit is that AP = magic damage = abilities = burst, and that AD = physical damage = basic attacks = DPS, but there are so many exceptions to those rules that everything sort of blends into each other. Some of the game's most prominent assassins, i.e. burst casters, are AD physical damage-dealers (e.g. Kha'Zix, Talon, Zed, etc.), and DPS champions like Cassiopeia, Ryze and Swain, plus heavy autoattackers like Ekko and Diana, are all AP. Some random abilities like Miss Fortune's Q, Tryndamere's E and Akali's E all deal AP-scaling physical damage, and AD champions like Corki and Shyvana are known for dealing a ton of magic damage, often more than physical. 

At this point, it feels like damage types are allocated more based on which class the champion belongs to, than based on what could work on them, which isn't what's the most obvious, either, with cases like Alistar (who smacks you around with his bare hands and horns, but deals magic damage), Kindred (who kills you with magical death arrows, which deal physical damage) and Taliyah (deals magic damage to you with rocks) all being examples of function over form. It feels like some champions get allocated their damage type on a coinflip, and despite the heavy limitations this often imposes on what they can and can't build, there isn't really a good explanation for why they're intended to be built only one way and not the other. Even though League is a game deeply entrenched now in its damage types, plus its associated resists and counter-resists, I think it might be useful if Riot eventually reexamined that system and either set some clear guidelines to make it more intuitive and meaningful, or perhaps even got rid of it altogether.
Don't forget; Yorick's Ult deals magic damage, but scales with AD.

This too, I missed quite a few actually (there's also Garen's ult, which is the only source of magic damage on a heavily physical damage-based character, plus Camille's on-hit magic damage on her ult, on top of her physical and true damage, though neither technically scale). This just reinforces the idea that damage types are all over the place, and while I guess that some are added to avoid champions getting counterbuilt by armor too hard, it just makes itemization more confusing as a whole, particularly since often those damage types have been added rather gratuitiously (Camille, again, doesn't need armor-ignoring magic damage when she already has true and max health damage at her disposal).

There's also Morde, with some of the most random scalings ever.
Mace of Spades: First/Second Strike: (+ 50 / 60 / 70 / 80 / 90% AD) (+ 60% AP) Third Strike: (+ 100 / 120 / 140 / 160 / 180% AD) (+ 120% AP) 
Siphon of Destruction: (+ 60% AD) (+ 60% AP)

The problem is that you can't really afford to buy any Penetration, and Armor as a base stat is much higher than Magic Resist in general.

You would have a small damage advantage in the Early Game. Then, after your opponents get some levels and Base Armor, your Damage will be extremely low.

Doesn't stop AD casters from dealing damage. Jhin deals a lot of damage with every auto, even without a pen build thanks to just how much AD he can get. Taliyah could also itemize into a Black Cleaner for fast armor reduction with her multi hit spells.

Yes, but they build armor penetration + AD.

Taliyah can't build armor penetration + AP.

Who says you need to build pen at all? There's only two sources of flat magic pen from items, one isn't bought by most mages anyway {{item:3136}}  and some mages prefer {{item:3158}} over {{item:3020}}. In terms of percentage pen it would just mean she would build a {{item:3035}}  item or {{item:3071}} , which isn't that different from how {{champion:42}} builds {{item:3135}}  even if he's going AD.

Corki still has plenty of AP ratios, so the AP on Void Staff isn't wasted.  Also Liandry's is becoming a much more popular item now.

The main advantage physical damage has over magic is that it is generally a constant, high output.  Taliyah wouldn't have that advantage because that advantage comes from AD scaling autos, and Taliyah wouldn't have much ad for autos or even want to auto often.

It could work if they put some pen into her kit though (like Corki).  For instance if they made it so her E shredded armor rather than slow or something, that may work.

Mobi's coupled with her passive could make her one of the best roamers in the game, and Lucidity would put a lot more emphasis on her control. Opting into Merc Treads/Tabi could also be tremendously useful if she's faced up against a bursty champion, as she tends to suffer against those types. Considering how Taliyah's a mobile control mage first and foremost, it would make sense for her to relax her damage itemization a little in favor of more utility.
